parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game6</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version6</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Radio and Chat

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Shows or hides the radio on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [[true]]).
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>This command exists in Arma 3 but doesn't do much!</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''showRadio''' show

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  show: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[showRadio]] [[false]];</code>

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>seealso [[shownRadio]], [[showCompass]], [[showGPS]], [[showWatch]], [[showPad]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 16 Aug, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Generalcarver|GeneralCarver]]<dd class="note">
In Arma 2, the radio is now an item in Arma 2. Class path is CfgWeapons->ItemRadio. Use the command addWeapon and removeWeapon to remove it from a unit's inventory. (example: player removeweapon "ItemRadio")


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
